attributes.name: NASF Season 2
attributes.description:
Season 2

NASF League Official Rules


Welcome to the NASF League! Below are the official rules and guidelines for the league. Please read through them carefully to ensure a smooth and fair experience for all participants.


**SIGN-UPS close June 15th!**


1. General League Structure


Regular Season:


10 groups with 7 players each.


Round-robin format: Each player faces every other player once.


Matches will be Best of 3 (Bo3).


Top 4 players from each group advance to playoffs.


Playoffs:


Single-elimination format.


Matches:


All except the Grand Final: Best of 3 (Bo3).


Grand Final: Best of 5 (Bo5).


Divisions:


Players grouped based on similar matchmaking ratings (MMR).


Balanced divisions depending on the number of signups.


2. Eligibility


Who Can Join?


Open to the entire community.


- Players with a history of spamming, harassment, or inappropriate behavior will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.

- Previously banned players are not eligible.

- Players who have been suspended or banned from the "Show Match Friday" Discord are ineligible.

- New players are encouraged but recommended to have at least 20 solo games played on W3C.
- Players who have quit the league, forfeited too many games in the past, or were overall difficult with communication will either be wait listed or suspended from playing in Season 2.


Race Selection:


- Players must declare their race and stick to it for the series.

- Random is an option.


Disqualifications:


- Players can be refused entry if they are suspected of using Smurf accounts or falsifying identities on Discord, Twitch, Challonge, Battle.net, or W3C.

- Behavior violating Terms of Service (ToS) may result in bans from Discord and tournaments.

- Players banned from discord, w3c, or my twitch channel ineligible to play.

- Players with a history of misconduct across communities may be banned without prior notice.

- Players caught stream sniping on ladder or other events will be ineligible to participate or will be removed from the league if discovered by the administration.


3. Registration


To Join the League:


- Join the "Show Match Friday" Discord for updates and discussions.

- Challonge Link: https://challonge.com/NASF2

- Check out Season 2


4. Schedule


Dates:


Spots are starting to fill up! SIGNS UPS CLOSE on JUNE 15th!!!


- If Divisions are set before June 20th, players can start earlier.,

- Regular Season: June 20th - August 1st.,

- Playoffs: August 2nd - August 15th.,

- Players will be following challonge schedule.,


Rounds:

**Rounds: **

- Round 1 + 2 + 3 June 20th - June 28th,

- Round 4 + 5 June 29th - July 5th,

- Round 6 + 7 July 6th - July 12th,

- Round 8+ 9 July 13th - July 19th,

- Round 10 + Catchup July 20th - August 1st,


***Rounds to be adjusted based on number of players***


- Divisions that finish all their games before July 12th will be rewarded.,

- Once divisions are set, certain players could be invited for bonus show match perks.


Match Scheduling:


- Players are encouraged to have their matches casted by Mr. Mike on Friday nights.

- Players may schedule matches on other days but must communicate with their opponents.

- Play a minimum of 1-2 matches per week; see challonge schedule.


5. Prize Pool


- Donations can be made directly to Mr. Mike via streamelements/paypal or DM to inquire.

- $50 to playoff winners of each division.

- Updates or changes about prize changes will be mentioned in Discord.

- Possibility of surprise prizes!


6. Map Pool and Veto Process


Map Pool:

- Autumn Leaves v2

- Concealed Hill

- Last Refuge

- Northern Isles

- Shallow Grave

- Tidehunters

- Springtime

- Secret Valley v2

- Melting Valley v2

- Hammerfall

- Marshlight


AL, CH, LR, NI, SG, TH, ST, SVv2, MVv2, HF, ML


Map Veto Regular Season Process:


Players will veto maps before matches.


A B A B A B B A = 3 maps left

A player picks their loser map

B player picks their loser map

Last map is played first.


Map Veto Finals Process:


Players will veto maps before matches.


A B A B A B = 5 maps left

- Players alternate choosing maps until there is one map left. That becomes the starter map.


Race Declaration:


- Players must declare their race before vetoing maps.

- Cannot change race throughout the series unless random.


7. Reporting Results


Winner Responsibilities:


- Report results on Challonge.

- Upload match replays to the #results channel on Discord; label game date, player names, and group letter.


8. Disconnects and Forfeits


Disconnects


If a player disconnects:


- Before the 5-minute mark: The game will be replayed, up to a maximum of two replays.

- By the 3rd time (if player disconnects again before 5-minute mark): The game will result in a loss for the disconnecting player.

- Server desyncs: The game will be replayed once. If desync occurs again, the administration will decide the outcome.


Re-games:


- Same map and race must be used as in the original game.


In-Game Pauses


- Pauses are allowed but must not be abused. Prolonged pauses (e.g., over 10 minutes) may result in penalties. Submit replays for review if disputes arise.


Forfeits


- A match is considered forfeited if:

- A player fails to schedule or communicate within the seasons timeframe.

- A player has become difficult and keeps changing scheduled time (3x).

- A player is late to a scheduled match beyond a 20-minute grace period.

- Other; Administrations discretion.


Playoff Forfeits:


Prize money for forfeited playoff matches will roll over back into the Show Match Friday and League fundraising pool.


9. Conduct & Sportsmanship


General Rules:


- Respect fellow players and admins.

- Poor sportsmanship, sniping, cheating, or harassment will not be tolerated.


Admin Discretion:


- Admins reserve the right to disqualify or remove players for any behavior deemed harmful to the leagues integrity.


10. Game Coverage


Streaming:


- Mr. Mikes Twitch stream: https://www.twitch.tv/mrmikemtl.

- Co-streaming is welcome; reach out to Mr. Mike for permissions.


Caster Guidelines:


- Maintain professionalism (e.g., avoid swearing, vulgar language, or inappropriate behaviors while casting).

- Must use discord logo on chat and league logo during game.

- images: https://discord.com/channels/1062104298848256020/1318969636011638835


11. Additional Notes


- Players are encouraged to stay active on Discord for updates and discussions.

- Admins are available to mediate scheduling conflicts or disputes.

- NA Server rules.

- Ping Equalizer is not needed.


Thank you for being part of the NASF League! We hope you enjoy the competition, play fair, and have fun. Good luck!

attributes.name: NASF League Season 1
attributes.description:
NASF League Official Rules

Welcome to the NASF League! Below are the official rules and guidelines for the league. Please read through them carefully to ensure a smooth and fair experience for all participants.

1. General League Structure

  • Regular Season:

    • 6 groups with 6 players each.

    • Round-robin format: Each player faces every other player once.

    • Matches will be Best of 3 (Bo3).

    • Top 4 players from each group advance to playoffs.

  • Playoffs:

    • Single-elimination format.

    • Matches:

      • All except the Grand Final: Best of 3 (Bo3).

      • Grand Final: Best of 5 (Bo5).

  • Divisions:

    • Players grouped based on similar matchmaking ratings (MMR).

    • Balanced divisions depending on the number of signups.

2. Eligibility

  • Who Can Join?

    • Open to the entire community.

    • Players with a history of spamming, harassment, or inappropriate behavior will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.

    • Previously banned players are not eligible.

    • Players who have been suspended or banned from the "Show Match Friday" Discord are ineligible.

    • New players are encouraged but recommended to have at least 20 solo games played on W3C.

  • Race Selection:

    • Players must declare their race and stick to it for the series.

    • Random is an option.

  • Disqualifications:

    • Players can be refused entry if they are suspected of using Smurf accounts or falsifying identities on Discord, Twitch, Challonge, Battle.net, or W3C.

    • Behavior violating Terms of Service (ToS) may result in bans from Discord and tournaments.

    • Players with a history of misconduct across communities may be banned without prior notice.

    • Players caught stream sniping on ladder or other events will be ineligible to participate or will be removed from the league if discovered by the administration.

3. Registration

  • To Join the League:

    • Message Mr. Mike for registration details.

    • Join the "Show Match Friday" Discord for updates and discussions.

    • Challonge Link: https://challonge.com/NASF1

4. Schedule

  • Dates:

    • Regular Season: January 6th January 31st, 2025 (or divisions can wrap up earlier).

    • Playoffs: February 1st, 12:00 AM EST February 15th, 12:00 AM EST.

  • Match Scheduling:

    • Players are encouraged to have their matches casted by Mr. Mike on Friday nights.

    • Players may schedule matches on other days but must communicate with their opponents.

5. Prize Pool

  • Crowdfunding:

    • $50 to playoff winners of each division.

    • Matcherino donations can be made here.

    • Updates or changes about prize changes will be mentioned in Discord.

6. Map Pool and Veto Process

  • Map Pool:

    • Autumn Leaves v2

    • Concealed Hill

    • Northern Isles

    • Shallow Grave

    • Tidehunters

    • Echo Isles v2

    • Dortmund Hills

    • Secret Valley v2

    • Hammerfall

  • Map Veto Regular Season Process:

    • Players will veto maps before matches.

    • A B A B B A = 3 maps left

    • A player picks their loser map

    • B player picks their loser map

    • Last map is played first.

  • Map Veto Finals Process:

    • Players will veto maps before matches.

    • A B A B = 5 maps left

    • Players alternate choosing maps until there is one map left. That becomes the starter map.

  • Race Declaration:

    • Players must declare their race before vetoing maps.

    • Cannot change race throughout the series unless random.

7. Reporting Results

  • Winner Responsibilities:

    • Report results on Challonge.

    • Upload match replays to the #results channel on Discord; probably labeled by game names and match numbers.

8. Disconnects and Forfeits

Disconnects

  • If a player disconnects:

  1. Before the 5-minute mark: The game will be replayed, up to a maximum of two replays.

  2. By the 3rd time (if player disconnects again before 5-minute mark): The game will result in a loss for the disconnecting player.

  3. Server desyncs: The game will be replayed once. If desync occurs again, the administration will decide the outcome.

  • Re-games:

    • Same map and race must be used as in the original game.

    In-Game Pauses

    • Pauses are allowed but must not be abused. Prolonged pauses (e.g., over 10 minutes) may result in penalties. Submit replays for review if disputes arise.

    Forfeits

    • A match is considered forfeited if:

    1. A player fails to schedule or communicate within the seasons timeframe.

    2. A player has become difficult and keeps changing scheduled time (3x).

    3. A player is late to a scheduled match beyond a 20-minute grace period.

    4. Other; Administrations discretion.

  • Playoff Forfeits:

    • Prize money for forfeited playoff matches will roll over back into the Show Match Friday and League fundraising pool.

    9. Conduct & Sportsmanship

    • General Rules:

      • Respect fellow players and admins.

      • Poor sportsmanship, sniping, cheating, or harassment will not be tolerated.

    • Admin Discretion:

      • Admins reserve the right to disqualify or remove players for any behavior deemed harmful to the leagues integrity.

    10. Game Coverage

    • Streaming:

      • Mr. Mikes Twitch stream: https://www.twitch.tv/mrmikemtl.

      • Co-streaming is welcome; reach out to Mr. Mike for permissions.

    • Caster Guidelines:

      • Maintain professionalism (e.g., avoid swearing, vulgar language, or inappropriate behaviors while casting).

    11. Additional Notes

    • Players are encouraged to stay active on Discord for updates and discussions.

    • Admins are available to mediate scheduling conflicts or disputes.

    • NA Server rules.
    • Ping Equalizer is not needed.

    Thank you for being part of the NASF League! We hope you enjoy the competition, play fair, and have fun. Good luck!

attributes.name: Spicy Mayo Cup
attributes.description:
Spicy Mayo Cup is a Warcraft 3 solo tournament for players under 1800 MMR.


All rounds: Best-of-1


Prize Pool:


Winner: $35 USD

2nd Place: $15 USD


Veto process:


No Veto


Map Pool:


Round 1: TideHunters

Round 2: TurtleRock

Round 3: Echo Isles 2.0

Semi-finals: Twisted Meadows

Finals: Ruins of Azshara


Broadcasting


- All games/series must be casted by Mr. Mike and/or designated casters (will be chosen).

- One match up from round 1 and 2 will be casted before the other rounds.

- All Round 3, Semifinals, and Finals will be casted live on Stream. DO NO START without caster in game. Other Brackets will wait as games complete.

Additional rules:


- All players must be 1800 mmr or under (administration will make final call).

- All players must have at least 20 games played on w3champions.

- All players must join tournament server. The Mr.Mike Discord

- If players signed up and did not join the discord channel by the start of their matchup, it will be considered a DEF win for their opponent.

- Players banned from GYM may not enter the tournament

- All players must check and post in discord channel for game names.

- Players must check discord to see if their matchup is scheduled for casting on twitch.

- All bonus pool money will be rolled over into another tournament.

*Winners paid via PayPal.

attributes.name: Mayo Cup
attributes.description:
Mayo Cup is a Warcraft 3 solo tournament for players under 1400 MMR. Each Series will be a best of 3 until the finals, which will be a best of 5. Extra details below:

Prize Pool:


Winner: $30 USD

2nd Place: $15 USD

3rd Place: $5 USD

Link: Fundraising


Round 1: Best-of-1

Other rounds: Best-of-3

Finals: Best-of-5

Veto process

Player A is the player set higher in the bracket.


Pick & Ban:

Bo1: A - BB - AA - BB - AA - BB -> 1 map left over

Bo3: A - BB - AA - BB - AA -> BB - A / 3 maps left over

Bo5: A - BB - AA - BB -> AA - BB - A / 5 maps left over

Map Pool:


Autumn Leaves

Concealed Hill

Last Refuge

Northern Isles

Shallow Grave

Tidehunters

Twisted Meadows

Echo Isles 2.0

Springtime

Ruins of Azshara v2.1

Turtle Rock v1.6

Hammerfall

Starting date: August 11th with remaining series to be played on August 13th.

Broadcasting


All games/series must be casted by Mr. Mike and/or designated casters (To Be Announced).

All rounds be scheduled on a different days.


Additional rules:

- All players must be 1400 mmr or under (Admin discretion).

- All players must have at least 20 games played on w3champions.

- All players must join tournament server. The Mr.Mike Discord

- All players must schedule their series to be live streamed on twitch.

- All players must declare race before matchup.

- All players must stick to same race in series (unless random).

-All players may switch races between series. Provided race level is 1400 mmr or below (and opponents know before their matchup).

- All prizes paid via paypal.
